snippet: Many spoke of the horrors they endured as children, when the government was pursuing leftist guerrillas and anyone believed to be a sympathizer.
abstract: Members of Mayan indigenous group Ixil travel from their villages to offer somber testimony at genocide trial of former Guatemalan dictator Efrain Rios Montt, accused of presiding over killings of 200,000 Mayan Ixil from 1962 to 1996; prosecution witnesses speak of the horrors they endured as children, when the government made the entire Mayan Ixil population a military target.

byline.contributor: Mike McDonald contributed reporting from Guatemala City.

lead_paragraph: Many spoke of the horrors they endured as children, when the government was pursuing leftist guerrillas and anyone believed to be a sympathizer.
